extendedIngredients.name: artichoke hearts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 13.5- ounce can artichoke hearts packed in water, drained and chopped
metaInformation: packed in water, drained and chopped

extendedIngredients.name: part-skim mozzarella cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces fresh part-skim mozzarella cheese, chopped

extendedIngredients.name: roasted red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup chopped bottled roasted red bell pepper

recipes.title: Mediterranean Pasta Salad

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

recipes.instructions: 1. Cook pasta according to package instructions, omitting salt and fat.2. While pasta cooks, combine zest and juice of 1 lemon and 2 teaspoons olive oil in a large bowl; stir well with a whisk. Add artichoke hearts, cheese, bell pepper, and parsley; toss to combine.3. Place peas in a colander; when pasta is cooked, drain pasta over peas. Shake well to drain, but do not run under cold water. Add pasta and peas to artichoke mixture, and toss well until thoroughly combined. Serve warm or at room temperature.

steps.step: Cook pasta according to package instructions, omitting salt and fat.2. While pasta cooks, combine zest and juice of 1 lemon and 2 teaspoons olive oil in a large bowl; stir well with a whisk.
Add artichoke hearts, cheese, bell pepper, and parsley; toss to combine.3.
Place peas in a colander; when pasta is cooked, drain pasta over peas. Shake well to drain, but do not run under cold water.
Add pasta and peas to artichoke mixture, and toss well until thoroughly combined.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
